text: today I'm making pasta with parsnips and
bacon you're probably thinking pasta and
parsnips because honestly root
vegetables are not the first thing that
come to mind when you think of making a
sauce for pasta but it's the middle of
winter and parsnips adds such good sweet
flavor to the pasta with the bacon that
I say time to think of something new so
for my parsnips I'm gonna peel them and
then I'm gonna roast them and you're
probably thinking why would you roast
them if you're gonna be cooking a sauce
but roasting the parsnips is going to
add this other layer of caramelized
flavor and it just makes them even
sweeter than they are
and by the way parsnips are super sweet
while you parsnip doubters out there you
have to give them a chance then after I
peel though I'm going to cut them up
into little cubes because the more
surface area you're exposing to the heat
the more caramelization you're gonna get
and then the sweeter they taste and I'm
just gonna put these to roast the pasta
shape that I'm using today it's called
Campanelli it means little bells these
are great because they're ruffled and
they will catch all the little bits in
the sauce but you could also use
farfalle which are the little bow ties
those work great too this is important
you need a lot of salt for your pasta
water because this salt is what's gonna
season the pasta all the way on the
inside and you just can't add enough
salt later on to really get a big
seasoning so I want to cook it until
it's about two minutes before being done
because I'm gonna finish cooking it in
the sauce you can use either bacon or
pancetta here you're probably thinking
Oh pancetta is gonna be more authentic
but for this dish bacon is a little bit
better because it has a smoky flavor
which is so nice with the parsnip and
then once that's brown I'm going to cook
a week in the fact I've left about a
tablespoon just enough to coat the
bottom of the pan when the leeks are
soft and they're golden in places this
is where I'm gonna add my heavy cream
and I'm gonna put my bacon back in the
pan
this is an important step so don't skimp
on the reducing of the cream because
what you're doing is you're evaporating
the water content and the cream is
getting thicker and that's what makes it
a nice thick sauce see how it's a little
bit golden that's what you're looking
for and now at this point I'm gonna add
my pasta back in and I'm gonna add my
parsnips too in a way the parsnips are
almost an extension of the pasta so they
take on the sauce too and it just makes
a really interesting texture you're
biting into something you're like a
pasta loose off first step but they both
taste like bacon and cream and cheese
parmesan and parsley and that's it I'm
gonna just plate it up here just gonna
finish it with a little bit of pepper
it's so rich it's gonna need that
peppery bite this dish kind of reminds
me of carbonara because of the bacon
maybe crossed with the mac and cheese
because of all that parmesan and then of
course you have the comfort factor of
that roasted parsnips just mixed right
in I don't think you can find a cozier
pasta dish
